author: rab810
title: Johnny Freakin' Thunder!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: I am too young to remember the original LEGO Adventurers sets, but I always wished that LEGO would bring them back. I love that this minifigure is a throwback to the classic Johnny Thunder. The face is perfect, and the hat, magnifying glass, and backpack are a nice touch. I also love the new chameleon piece.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Johnny Thunder's Distant Cousin.
review:
Set #71025 Jungle Explorer: This wonderful looking character is dressed up for deep jungle exploration and adventure. He has the hat, a familiar looking style of jacket printed on his torso, some tough leather pants, or slacks for you UK folks, and sturdy brown boots courtesy of his dual-moulded legs. Equipped with a magnifying glass and a backpack and a facial print that bears some similarities with famous LEGO adventurer Johnny Thunder, this fellow is prepared to discover all manner of treasure.

In fact he includes a new chamelon piece to add to the ever-expanding collection of LEGO Animals. Done in a rich green tone with some nice colourful markings, this little guy can fit over a Minifigures hand or any 1x1 stud.

Overall this is a great little Minifigure from Series 19 and if you can you should aim to get multiples of him. Highly Recommended.

author: AETerry
title: Jungle Explorer
review:
This minifigure is definitely reminiscent of older themes for Adventurers, he makes me think of potentially, a slightly older Johnny Thunder from the 90's.

The print quality is good for the Collectible Minifigure line. The notable accessory pieces are the backpack and the chameleon animal piece.

It's a solid figure that accomplishes the concept and goes beyond with the quality of print and accessories to bring this CMF to life.
